problem.p: What are some of the advantages and disadvantages to using each of the different types of lateral-force resisting systems?

div.p: Moment resisting frames tend to be the most flexible, use the least amount of material, and allow for lots of openings. Braced frames tend to be quite stiff and fairly efficient but creating openings is more difficult. Shearwalls are quite stiff and fairly easy to build but require a fair amount of materials and do not allow for openings.
